brainly_data.question: Which campaign pledge was president george h.w. bush forced to break in order to address the enormous federal budget deficit carried over from the reagan administration?
brainly_data.subject: History

all_answers.question: Which campaign pledge was president george h.w. bush forced to break in order to address the enormous federal budget deficit carried over from the reagan administration?
all_answers.subject: History
all_answers.text:
No new taxes

President Bush snr, had pledged that he would not pursue additional tax, but found himself in the middle of a recession orchestrated by the economic policies of his predecessor. Largely though, this pledge cost him the 1992 re-election bid.
